section.name: Data Types
section.p: Most of the data types are self explanatory and are adapted to the database in use. Refer to the database documentation for its data types specifics.
The following sections document data types within dbUnit.

subsection.name: Blob
subsection.p: Blobs contain binary data. DbUnit, however, processes data with XML or CSV files containing textual data sets, not binary. To push binary data into a database blob from dbUnit data set files, use the following syntax in a data set field:
The table below shows how to use each of the forms available to load binary data into a blob.

tr.td:
Insert text in a blob. By default the encoding used is UTF-8, but optionally any encoding can be provided.
Example with UTF-8 encoding:
<!DOCTYPE dataset SYSTEM "my-dataset.dtd"> <dataset> <TABLE_WITHBLOB COL0="[TEXT]This is my text, saved in UTF-8 (default) encoding. Java: bon café!" COL1="row 0 col 1" COL2="row 0 col 2"/> </dataset>
Example with ISO-8859-1 encoding:
<!DOCTYPE dataset SYSTEM "my-dataset.dtd"> <dataset> <TABLE_WITHBLOB COL0="[TEXT ISO-8859-1]This is my text, saved in ISO-8859-1 encoding. Java: bon café!" COL1="row 0 col 1" COL2="row 0 col 2"/> </dataset>

Insert binary in a blob using Base64
Example:
<!DOCTYPE dataset SYSTEM "my-dataset.dtd"> <dataset> <TABLE_WITHBLOB COL0="[BASE64]VGhpcyBpcyBteSB0ZXh0Lg==" COL1="row 0 col 1" COL2="row 0 col 2"/> </dataset>

Insert the content of a binary file in a blob. The path may contains spaces.
Example:
<!DOCTYPE dataset SYSTEM "my-dataset.dtd"> <dataset> <TABLE_WITHBLOB COL0="[FILE]/path/to file to download" COL1="row 0 col 1" COL2="row 0 col 2"/> </dataset>

Insert the content pointed by a URL in a blob.
Example:
<!DOCTYPE dataset SYSTEM "my-dataset.dtd"> <dataset> <TABLE_WITHBLOB COL0="[URL]http://url%20here" COL1="row 0 col 1" COL2="row 0 col 2"/> </dataset>

subsection.name: Relative date, time, and timestamp
subsection.p: It is possible to push date, time, and timestamp values relative to the current date/time by using the following syntax in a data set field (since 2.7.0):

diff consists of two parts 1) a number with a leading plus or minus sign and 2) a character represents temporal unit. See the list below for the supported units. There can be multiple diffs and they can be specified in any order.
time is a string that can be parsed by LocalTime#parse(). If specified, it is used instead of the current time.
Both diff and time are optional.
Whitespaces are allowed before and after each diff.

ul.li: [now+1y+1M-2h] : a year and a month from today, two hours earlier
